image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Overcrowding in the Alice Springs jail has contributed to a $460,000 repair bill at the facility, with pressure on the NT's prisons only set to grow after the introduction of tough new bail laws.

title.children: Overcrowding, riots blamed for $460k repairs at Alice Springs jail

image.altText: Jacinta Price speaks while Dutton stands behind her listening.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price asserts Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is "absolutely" committed to ending "indoctrination" in schools by teachers, just hours after Mr Dutton said the Coalition had no proposal to change the curriculum.

title.children: Nampijinpa Price contradicts Dutton, asserting Coalition will end school 'indoctrination'

image.altText: Grey horse crosses the line at races

props.synopsis: A review of the Northern Territory racing industry is being undertaken by a consultancy firm that also represents Australiaâ€™s largest gambling company, sparking questions about its integrity.

title.children: Firm linked to major gambling company conducting NT government racing review

image.altText: Cars bogged in heavy mud in bush

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people living on remote homelands in the Northern Territory have been cut off from essential services following flooding in remote east Arnhem Land.

title.children: 'There's no help': NT homelands cut off from food, fuel following floods

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton tells reporters in WA that he and his team have "worked hard every day and night" during the campaign and "there's no doubt in my mind we can be successful in the election". Follow live.Â

title.children: Dutton has 'no doubt' the Coalition can win this election

image.altText: voters

props.synopsis: As the countdown to May 3 draws nearer, a growing group of gen Z and millennial voters are threatening to destabilise key seats. Here's why.Â

title.children: The 'unpredictable' group of voters that could influence these key seats

image.altText: Mike Waltz wears a checked shirt and cold-weather jacket.

props.synopsis: The Trump adviser responsible for the Signal group chat that became a national security scandal is being replaced and nominated as the next US ambassador at the United Nations.

title.children: Trump ousts 'Signalgate' national security adviser Mike Waltz

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson's estranged husband Simon Patterson appears for the second day as a witness in her trial. Follow the hearing in our live blog.

title.children: Simon Patterson testifies in Erin Patterson's murder trial

image.altText: two male politicians wearing suits at a park

props.synopsis: The Coalition enters the dying hours of the 2025 election campaign defending its budget against charges from some of the nation's top economists that it erodes the Coalition's self-declared legacy of fiscal responsibility.

title.children: Voter 'bribes' send Taylor 'off brand' with bigger deficits, say budget experts

image.altText: A mural dedicated to the Australian women killed by domestic violence in 2024 and 2025

props.synopsis: Violence against women has stirred outrage among voters and politicians have promised to do something about it. Their policy proposals tell a different story, write Heidi Davoren and Mary Lloyd.

title.children: It's the 'national crisis' that neither party has been able to solve

image.altText: Albanese stands in the middle of a group of children, he's looking to the side with palms pressed together in greeting

props.synopsis: As Albanese and Dutton crisscrossed the country aiming to win over voters, ABC photographers were there to capture the best images of the campaign.Â

title.children: As Australia prepares to vote, we look back on the best photos of a frantic election campaign

image.altText: Unidentified woman in forground with left hand holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan

props.synopsis: A child born to an overseas commercial surrogate is in legal limbo, with experts estimating hundreds of other Australian children are also living with uncertain parentage.

title.children: Children left in legal limbo amid Australia's complex surrogacy laws

image.altText: A crashed helicopter in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Three people suffered serious injuries when their helicopter crashed in water between Point Lonsdale and Ocean Grove on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula.

title.children: Three people survive helicopter crash near Geelong

image.altText: A map highlights locations in the north Pacific Ocean, near Hawai'i

props.synopsis: Scientists and legal experts warn against commercial deep-sea mining as US President Donald Trump signs an executive order opening up both US and international waters.

title.children: 'Inherently destructive': Trump's deep-sea mining order sparks backlash

image.altText: A jar of pencils.

props.synopsis: Think you know the numbers behind the federal election? Try our quiz!

title.children: Test your knowledge with our federal election numbers quiz

image.altText: The two men standing shoulder to shoulder, Pope Francis does not look amused

props.synopsis: The conclave will be a "fight for the soul of the Catholic Church" between those who saw promise in the modernising changes Pope Francis made and those "who hated him for it".Â

title.children: MAGA's 'vicious fight' for the 'soul of the Catholic church'

image.altText: An Amazon package sits on a doorstep.

props.synopsis: US stocks continue to reclaim ground from their post-tariff losses, with the S&P 500 gaining for an eighth straight session to reach its highest level since April 2. Amazon's shares fell in extended trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Amazon disappoints Wall St amid tariff uncertainty

image.altText: A man in a RAAF uniform

props.synopsis: A Queensland man accused of murdering his wife and staging a lawnmower accident to cover it up has been granted bail.

title.children: Ex-RAAF pilot accused of killing wife and staging mower accident bailed

image.altText: People walk on a pier in front of Singapore's merlion statue and the city's skyline

props.synopsis: It calls itself a democracy, yet the wealthy city-state has had the same ruling party since 1959. That is unlikely to change anytime soon.

title.children: Singapore's election is also on Saturday â€” but we already know the outcome

image.altText: Flames come out of a long two-storey burning building at night.

props.synopsis: Queensland police are yet to formally identify a body found in the Bowen hostel, which went up in flames on the day new owners were due to take over.

title.children: Fatal hostel fire 'suspicious' as backpacker tells of lucky escape

image.altText: Anna Kendrick and Blake Lively stand next to each other and look seriously at the camera, there is a red background

props.synopsis: Blake Lively and Anna Kendrick come back to their world of fashion, martinis and murder for the equally deranged and delightful sequel to 2018's hit A Simple Favor.Â

title.children: Another Simple Favor is just as deranged and delightful as the first film

image.altText: A dentist wearing a face mask places a tube inside a patient's mouth.

props.synopsis: Two thirds of Australian dental practitioners recently surveyed support expanding Medicare to include subsidised dental services, with many reporting patients are struggling to afford oral health care.

title.children: Dentists back calls to expand Medicare as cost of living bites

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: The post linked to state-run media said that the US had reached out through multiple channels hoping to discuss its tariff policy with Beijing.

title.children: A Chinese state media post points to a softening in the US-China trade war

image.altText: People walk through the Chadstone Shopping Centre

props.synopsis: Labor and the Coalition are promising to spend big to help households deal with the cost of living. Here's what you need to know.

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Kr in a black suit and tie sitting at a table while speaking and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: The US Health Secretary has incorrectly claimed the measles jab contains aborted foetus cells, while scientists warn the country is at a tipping point for the infection to become endemic for the first time in 25 years.Â

title.children: RFK Jr revives debunked measles vaccine claims as US nears 900 cases

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An incident at sea, a shell-based discovery and a voting refresher course

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli looks up with the ball as other players surround him

props.synopsis: Footy teams and experts talk constantly about the importance of winning clearances, but there is much more to it than simply getting to the ball first.

title.children: How the best AFL teams can win games through clearances

image.altText: A man wearing a white business shirt sitting at an office desk cluttered by folders and files

props.synopsis: The CIA has released two short videos that appear designed to tap into possible discontent in the Chinese government and encourage leaks of sensitive state secrets to the US.

title.children: CIA releases videos encouraging Chinese officials to leak secrets to US

image.altText: A close up composite photo of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese at the debate.

props.synopsis: When we look back, we can see the road to election day has had a multitude of signposts, flashing red lights, twists, turns and potholes.

image.altText: A woman with short, light hair, smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council is auctioning two dozen properties to recover unpaid rates. But local Gina Greentree says the council has bungled the process, with the farmer bidding for a lot she thought she owned.Â

title.children: Property of man dead for 65 years among lots auctioned for unpaid rates

props.synopsis: Graziers are watching pastures disappear, despite some spending tens of thousands to protect their paddocks from voracious swarms threatening to grow to plague proportions.

title.children: After the rains, locusts descend on western Queensland properties

image.altText: a faceless couple holding hands stand looking at camera

props.synopsis: Perimenopause symptoms like mood swings, low libido and hot flushes can make life difficult for those who experience them. For partners, it can be confusing too. But there are ways to help.

title.children: 'Shattered pane of glass': The impact of perimenopause

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris pose for a photograph together.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri leaps to the defence of Lando Norris after ex-Formula 1 world champion Alan Jones suggests the Briton lacks mental toughness.

title.children: Piastri defends teammate Norris after ex-world champion's 'weak' jibe

image.altText: Jocelyn Kelleher, Isabelle Kelly, Tiana Penitani, Kezie Apps and Shaylee Bent smile after winning State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: The Blues have used more than twice as many halves as Queensland in the past decade of Women's State of Origin. Thursday's series opener suggests that carousel is about to stop.

title.children: After years of searching, have the Blues found the icing on their cake?
